member.name: T:StiLib.Core.SLForm
member.summary: StiLib base form class to Host a XNA render window

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.#ctor
member.summary: Init to Default -- width:800, height:600, refreshrate:0, Vsync:true, showcursor:true

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the SLForm hosting XNA GraphicsDevice

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Redraws in response to a WinForms paint message

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.OnPaintBackground(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Ignores WinForms paint-background messages. The default implementation would clear the client to the current background color, causing flickering when our OnPaint implementation then immediately draws some other color over the top using the XNA Framework GraphicsDevice.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the SLForm, unloading the ContentManager.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.Initialize
member.summary: Derived classes override this to initialize their drawing code.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.LoadContent
member.summary: LoadContent will be called before Initialize() and is the place to load all of your content.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.UnloadContent
member.summary: UnloadContent will be called once SLForm is to disposed and is the place to unload all content.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.Draw
member.summary: Derived classes override this to draw themselves using the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.SetFlow
member.summary: Set Flow Control to begin a new Experiment

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLForm.MarkHead
member.summary: Transfer Experiment MarkerHeader only once before it's running

member.name: P:StiLib.Core.SLForm.Services
member.summary: Gets an IServiceProvider containing our IGraphicsDeviceService. This can be used with components such as the ContentManager, which use this service to look up the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: P:StiLib.Core.SLForm.GO_OVER
member.summary: Toggle Between Content Run(true) and RunOver(false) State

member.name: T:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl
member.summary: Custom control uses the XNA Framework GraphicsDevice to render onto a Windows Form. Derived classes can override the Initialize and Draw methods to add their own drawing code.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Redraws the control in response to a WinForms paint message.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.BeginDraw
member.summary: Attempts to begin drawing the control. Returns an error message string if this was not possible, which can happen if the graphics device is lost, or if we are running inside the Form designer.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.EndDraw
member.summary: Ends drawing the control. This is called after derived classes have finished their Draw method, and is responsible for presenting the finished image onto the screen, using the appropriate WinForms control handle to make sure it shows up in the right place.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.HandleDeviceReset
member.summary: Helper used by BeginDraw. This checks the graphics device status, making sure it is big enough for drawing the current control, and that the device is not lost. Returns an error string if the device could not be reset.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.PaintUsingSystemDrawing(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String)
member.summary: If we do not have a valid graphics device (for instance if the device is lost, or if we are running inside the Form designer), we must use regular System.Drawing method to display a status message.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.OnPaintBackground(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Ignores WinForms paint-background messages. The default implementation would clear the control to the current background color, causing flickering when our OnPaint implementation then immediately draws some other color over the top using the XNA Framework GraphicsDevice.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.Initialize
member.summary: Derived classes override this to initialize their drawing code.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.Update
member.summary: Derived classes override this to updata their drawing code.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.Draw
member.summary: Derived classes override this to draw themselves using the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: P:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.GraphicsDevice
member.summary: Gets a GraphicsDevice that can be used to draw onto this control.

member.name: P:StiLib.Core.SLGDControl.Services
member.summary: Gets an IServiceProvider containing our IGraphicsDeviceService. This can be used with components such as the ContentManager, which use this service to look up the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLAudio.Initialize(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)

The filepath to the streaming wave bank with default -- offset:0, packetsize:64

member.summary: Loads the categories into the AudioSystem. This allows the system to adjust the volume of the categories with the GolbalVolume.

member.summary: Gets a sound catagory from the audio engine.

member.summary: Pauses all cues currently being played.

member.summary: Resumes all paused cues played through the AudioSystem.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLAudio.Stop(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioStopOptions)
member.summary: Stops all cues played through the AudioSystem. Stopped cues cannot be resumed.
member.param: Controls how the cues should stop.

member.param: Variables to be applied to the cue.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLAudio.Play(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.Cue,StiLib.Core.CueVariable[])
member.summary: Plays a cue. This method prevents the cue being collected by the garbage collecter while the cue is playing, so references to the cue outside of the AudioSystem can be safely lost.
member.param: Variables to be applied to the cue.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLAudio.Play(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.AudioEmitter,StiLib.Core.CueVariable[])
member.summary: Plays a sound in 3D to all the AudioListeners listed in Listeners.
member.param: Name of the sound to be played.
member.remarks: If there are no listeners, then the sound is just played normally.
member.param: Variables to be applied to the cue.

member.summary: Sets the volume of a catagory

member.name: T:StiLib.Core.SLGDService
member.summary: The GraphicsDeviceService is responsible for creating and managing the GraphicsDevice. All GraphicsDeviceService consumer instances share the same GraphicsDeviceService. This class implements the standard IGraphicsDeviceService interface, which provides notification events for when the device is reset or disposed.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDService.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor is private, because this is a singleton class. Client should use the public AddRef method instead.

member.summary: Gets a reference to the singleton instance.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDService.Release(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases a reference to the singleton instance.

member.name: M:StiLib.Core.SLGDService.ResetDevice(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets the graphics device to whichever is bigger out of the specified resolution or its current size. This behavior means the device will demand-grow to the largest of all its clients.
